objectives: Produce core family signs and set up family members in space
Ask/answer about siblings and children using HOW-MANY
Introduce relatives using indexing and possessives

vocab.def: F-hands circle to show a group.
From forehead/chin to L-shape at other hand.
Baby motion from chin; CHILDREN hands move outward.

sections.heading: Set Up a Family Map
sections.body: Anchor **MOTHER (left)**, **FATHER (right)**, siblings in front. Reuse the same space when referring back.

sections.heading: Introduce Relatives
sections.body: Example: **FAMILY ME. MOTHER NAME J-A-N-E. FATHER NAME L-E-O.** Use indexing to point back to each.

sections.heading: Siblings & Children
sections.body: Ask **HOW-MANY SIBLING YOU?** Answer with number-first: **TWO BROTHER ONE SISTER.**

sections.heading: Partner Drill
sections.body: A introduces family members (names can be fingerspelled). B asks **HOW-MANY**, then repeats back one detail to confirm.

items.q: Gloss: 'I have one brother, two sisters' (number-first).

items.prompt: Which relative signs feel tricky? Why?

reflectionPrompt: Record a 20‚Äì30s family intro with at least 3 relatives.
summary: You mapped family members in space, asked HOW-MANY, and used indexing to refer back clearly.
